TEXT: The applicant [ Mr PERSON ] is a GPE national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON , in the GPE of GPE , in GPE .

On DATE the applicant made an application to be entered in the electoral register ( Stimmregister ) for the municipality of ORG in GPE in order to vote in the referendum ( PERSON ) scheduled for DATE on whether GPE should join ORG .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( Gemeinde - vorstehung ) informed the applicant that it could not grant his application , because he had been residing in PERSON , in GPE , for DATE and therefore did not satisfy the statutory requirement as to place of residence . By the terms of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the CARDINAL DATE version of the Rights of LAW ( Volksrechtegesetz ) ( Official Gazette DATE , no . CARDINAL ) , persons are entitled to vote only if they are GPE nationals who have reached DATE and have a place of ordinary abode ( ordentlicher ORG ) in GPE DATE before the date of the elections or the referendum .

On DATE the applicant appealed to the GPE government on the ground that the result of the referendum would be decisive for him and for all GPE nationals living abroad and that place of residence could not be accepted as the only criterion for participation in elections or a referendum .
In a decision of DATE the government dismissed the appeal , likewise referring to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Rights of LAW .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against this decision with ORG ( Verwaltungs - beschwerdeinstanz ) . He argued that by denying them the right to vote , the legislature deprived GPE nationals living abroad of the fundamental right to participate in their country ’s democratic life .

In a decision of DATE ORG refused to refer the question of the constitutionality of the impugned statutory requirement to ORG ) . It held that the principle of depriving GPE nationals living abroad of the right to vote was not unconstitutional and referred to a judgment of ORG on that issue . As to the applicant ’s application for inclusion in the electoral register for the municipality of ORG , the court upheld the government ’s decision .
From DATE there was a debate nationally and in ORG on the question of introducing a postal vote ( ORG ) in GPE .
In CARDINAL letters dated DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant drew ORG ’s attention to the need to include also GPE nationals living abroad .

In observations of DATE sent to ORG the government expressed its opposition to giving GPE nationals living abroad the right to vote , having regard , in particular , to their large number in proportion to the number of residents . In DATE CARDINAL GPE nationals lived abroad as opposed to CARDINAL who lived in GPE .
On DATE ORG confirmed that GPE nationals living abroad did not have the right to vote .
